Pre mint, the value of an NFT is 90% art, 10% utility 

Post mint itâ€™s 90% utility, 10% art 

Thereâ€™s still a huge feeling of â€˜now whatâ€™ whenever a project reveals- projects which add consistent value to the token are the only ones which will hold their price

Weâ€™re in a dangerous time with FOMO at an all time high 

People are playing with money they canâ€™t afford to lose in the hope of the next big win

Rug pulls drain the space of liquidity and tarnish the whole industry

It sucks and the tech is the best way to solve this

Creators should have to commit to the artwork theyâ€™re selling and provide a significant sample of the artwork before itâ€™s minted 

At @thirdweb_ weâ€™ve implemented tech which requires creators to â€˜lock inâ€™ artwork at mint - a strong first step https://t.co/i0hQKFujHR

We use language like â€œDYORâ€ and â€œRuggedâ€ to make light of these situations but this places responsibility on buyers as opposed to creators

Instead we should be doing more to make shit like this impossible to pull off - otherwise weâ€™re going nowhere

Pixelmon is funny but reversed  progress in the NFT space

Itâ€™s difficult to argue against the â€˜NFTs are a scamâ€™ argument when there are so many public scams disguised as NFT drops

False advertising is illegal and creators should be held accountable

@DougAtLast I got the impression IreneDAO blew up as a meme more than anything

focus is going to be a superpower in this space

thereâ€™s also a heightened understanding of marketing in this space

paid ads and influencers for example are a red flag when weighing up a project 

a community built organically is much more valuable and likely to last than one built through paid
